title.narrative: Innovation, Development and Entrepreneurship for All: Regional programme for job creation with the support of local private sector in ECOWAS region

description.narrative:
Most ECOWAS states share similar constraints when it comes to unemployment: (a) the mismatch of educational and vocational trainings to the requirements of local job markets indeed a large youth are lacking sustainable livelihood options due to the fact that they have no skills nor practical and relevant experience for employment; (b) limited entrepreneurial and managerial skills to start and develop their own economic ventures; (c) limited access to finance services; (d) restricted access to information and relevant business networks; (e) low support from business development services. All these constraints are a serious impediment to engagement in productive activities and integration in their local economies, particularly for youth and women.
At the same time, most ECOWAS economies are confronted with limited supply-side capacity of local private sector, in particular small enterprises. Supporting local private sector agencies and business development services is therefore crucial.
Thus, the proposed project, which capitalizes on the expertise and comparative advantage of UNIDO, aims to provide an integrated and sustainable approach to unemployment and effective engagement in productive activities through entrepreneurship and job creation at the ECOWAS level starting with pilot projects in 8 ECOWAS countries. The project’s intervention is three fold: (i) support to youth entrepreneurship development for job creation; (ii) Effective skills development in line with market demands; (iii) strengthening capacity of local private sector agencies/BDS (Business Development Services) and providing technical assistance to local SMEs to foster local economic development.
In addition, this project is fully in line with the IDDA3 mandate of UNIDO (Pillars 3, 4 and 5). Indeed, it promotes human capital, sectors with high potential for growth, agribusiness value chains development, access to information and communication technology, economic diversification. It fosters private-public partnership while supporting entrepreneurship and private sector development with a special emphasis on youth and women’s empowerment.
Finally, the programme goes along with the UNIDO Youth strategy: (1) Create enabling ecosystems for youth-led SME development, entrepreneurship and self- employment; (2) Support youth in acquiring the technical and entrepreneurial skills to enter the world of work and (3) Enhance the integration of youth across UNIDO’s priorities and functions to scale up UNIDO’s impact.
